body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then number of prime(s) among "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n + 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\ldots "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n + 2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is?"}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Every number in the sequence can be factorized. The sequence can be rewritten as"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016!+2, 2016!+3, ..., 2016!+2016\\2(\frac {2016!}{2}+1), 3(\frac{2016!}{3}+1), ... 2016(\frac {2016!}{2016}+1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the set of all positive integers between 1 and 2017, inclusive.  Suppose that the least common multiple of all elements in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"L"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Find the number of elements in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that do not divide "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac L{2016}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"L = 2^{10} \cdot 3^6 \cdot 7^3 \cdot P,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a product of other prime powers. Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"L/2016 = 2^5 \cdot 3^4 \cdot 7^2 \cdot P."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" So we are looking for numbers which are divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^6,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^5,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7^3."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" No number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\le 2017"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by two of these simultaneously, so we can count each one separately."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lfloor 2017 / 2^6 \rfloor = 31"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" numbers divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^6,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lfloor 2017 / 3^5 \rfloor = 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" numbers divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^5,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lfloor 2017 / 7^3 \rfloor = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" numbers divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7^3,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"31 + 8 + 5 = \fbox{44}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: The Product is 2016, But Minimize the Sum
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The product of three natural numbers is equal to 2016. What's the least possible value for their sum?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You can even use AM GM inequality."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{a+b+c}{3}≥\sqrt[3]{abc}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that abc=2016,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c≥3 \times \sqrt[3]{2016}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
=>"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c≥3 \times 12.633"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For minimum value, 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c=3 \times 12.633
=>a+b+c=37.899
≈\boxed{38}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            This proves that no sum less than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"38"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is possible, but this fact alone does not give the answer.  We still need to factorize "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and discover that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(12, 12, 14)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a solution to conclude that the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"38"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016=4×504=4×4×126=4×4×14×9=
4×4×14×3×3=12×12×14. To see the sum minimum the nubers must be as close as possible to each other. So 12+12+14=38."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Give the last three digits of the sum of cubes of the first 2016 natural numbers."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of the cubes of the first n numbers: (n(n+1)/2)^2 
Plug in 2016 we obtain, 2033136^2 
Under modulo 1000
(2033136^2)mod1000=== 136^2mod1000= 496mod1000"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016^n+\underbrace{2016^2+2016^2+\ldots+2016^2}_{p\text{ times}}=2016^3\\
2016^n+p(2016^2)=2016^3\\
p(2016^2)=2016^3-2016^n\\
p=\dfrac{2016^3-2016^n}{2016^2}\\
p=2016-2016^{n-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is positive, we know that"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016-2016^{n-2}>0\\
2016^1>2016^{n-2}\\
1>n-2\\
n<3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an integer, we know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016^{n-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be an integer. This implies that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n-2 \geq 0\\
n \geq 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Combine the two conditions, we have"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 \leq n < 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For this range of values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", there is only one integer value that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can take, and that is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=\boxed{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2016 AMC 12B Problem 21
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABCD"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a unit square. Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the midpoint of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{CD}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". For "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i=1,2,\ldots,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the intersection of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{AQ_i}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{BD}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q_{i+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the foot of the perpendicular from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{CD}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum\limits_{i=1}^{\infty} \text{Area of }\triangle DQ_iP_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"? "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the whole set:  2016 AMC 12B Problems."}]}]}

title: 2016 AMC 12B Problem 23
